name: Simple Present
description: Describes a habitual action, general truth, or a permanent situation.

name: Present Continuous
description: Indicates an ongoing action happening at the moment of speaking.
example: He is reading a book now.

name: Present Perfect
description: Describes an action that happened at an unspecified time before now.

name: Present Perfect Continuous
description: Indicates an action that started in the past and is continuing in the present.
example: She has been studying for two hours.

name: Simple Past
description: Used for actions that happened at a specific time in the past.
example: They traveled to Japan last year.

name: Past Continuous
description: Describes an action that was happening at a certain time in the past.
example: She was watching TV when I called her.

name: Past Perfect
description: Used to talk about an action that was completed before another action took place in the past.
example: They had finished the project before the deadline.

name: Past Perfect Continuous
description: Describes an action that was ongoing in the past and was completed before another action.
example: He had been reading the book for a week when it was due.

name: Simple Future
description: Indicates an action that will happen in the future.
example: I will go to the grocery store tomorrow.

name: Future Continuous
description: Used for an action that will be happening at a specific time in the future.
example: He will be working all night.

name: Future Perfect
description: Indicates an action that will be completed before a specific time in the future.
example: By next month, I will have finished this course.

name: Future Perfect Continuous
description: Used to describe an ongoing action that will be completed at some specific point in the future.
example: By next year, she will have been working here for five years.
